info.title: AWS Marketplace Catalog Service
info.description:
Catalog API actions allow you to manage your entities through list, describe, and update capabilities. An entity can be a product or an offer on AWS Marketplace.

You can automate your entity update process by integrating the AWS Marketplace Catalog API with your AWS Marketplace product build or deployment pipelines. You can also create your own applications on top of the Catalog API to manage your products on AWS Marketplace.

servers.description: The AWS Marketplace Catalog multi-region endpoint
The AWS Marketplace Catalog multi-region endpoint
The AWS Marketplace Catalog endpoint for China (Beijing) and China (Ningxia)
The AWS Marketplace Catalog endpoint for China (Beijing) and China (Ningxia)

post.description: Removes a tag or list of tags from a resource (either an entity or change set).

ResourceArn.description: Required. The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) associated with the resource you want to remove the tag from.

TagKeys.description: Required. A list of key names of tags to be removed. Number of strings allowed: 0-256.

get.description: Provides information about a given change set.

allOf.description: Required. The unique identifier for the change set referenced in this request.
The ARN associated with the unique identifier for the change set referenced in this request.
The optional name provided in the StartChangeSet request. If you do not provide a name, one is set by default.
The date and time, in ISO 8601 format (2018-02-27T13:45:22Z), the request started.

The date and time, in ISO 8601 format (2018-02-27T13:45:22Z), the request transitioned to a terminal state. The change cannot transition to a different state. Null if the request is not in a terminal state.
The status of the change request.

Returned if the change set is in FAILED status. Can be either CLIENT_ERROR, which means that there are issues with the request (see the ErrorDetailList), or SERVER_FAULT, which means that there is a problem in the system, and you should retry your request.
Returned if there is a failure on the change set, but that failure is not related to any of the changes in the request.
The type of the change.
The type of entity.
The identifier for the entity.
An entity contains data that describes your product, its supported features, and how it can be used or launched by your customer.
The entity to be changed.
This object contains details specific to the change type of the requested change.
The error code that identifies the type of error.
The message for the error.

items.description: Details about the error.

allOf.description: An array of ErrorDetail objects associated with the change.
Optional name for the change.

items.description: This object is a container for common summary information about the change. The summary doesn't contain the whole change structure.

allOf.description: An array of ChangeSummary objects.

parameters.name: catalog
parameters.description: Required. The catalog related to the request. Fixed value: AWSMarketplace

parameters.name: changeSetId
parameters.description: Required. The unique identifier for the StartChangeSet request that you want to describe the details for.

get.description: Returns the metadata and content of the entity.

allOf.description: The named type of the entity, in the format of EntityType@Version.
The identifier of the entity, in the format of EntityId@RevisionId.
The ARN associated to the unique identifier for the entity referenced in this request.
The last modified date of the entity, in ISO 8601 format (2018-02-27T13:45:22Z).
This stringified JSON object includes the details of the entity.

parameters.name: catalog
parameters.description: Required. The catalog related to the request. Fixed value: AWSMarketplace

parameters.name: entityId
parameters.description: Required. The unique ID of the entity to describe.

get.description: Gets a resource-based policy of an Entity that is identified by its resource ARN.

allOf.description: The policy document to set; formatted in JSON.

parameters.name: resourceArn
parameters.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Entity resource that is associated with the resource policy.

post.description:
Returns the list of change sets owned by the account being used to make the call. You can filter this list by providing any combination of entityId, ChangeSetName, and status. If you provide more than one filter, the API operation applies a logical AND between the filters.

You can describe a change during the 60-day request history retention period for API calls.

allOf.description: The unique identifier for a change set.
The ARN associated with the unique identifier for the change set referenced in this request.
The non-unique name for the change set.
The time, in ISO 8601 format (2018-02-27T13:45:22Z), when the change set was started.
The time, in ISO 8601 format (2018-02-27T13:45:22Z), when the change set was finished.
The current status of the change set.
This object is a list of entity IDs (string) that are a part of a change set. The entity ID list is a maximum of 20 entities. It must contain at least one entity.

Returned if the change set is in FAILED status. Can be either CLIENT_ERROR, which means that there are issues with the request (see the ErrorDetailList of DescribeChangeSet), or SERVER_FAULT, which means that there is a problem in the system, and you should retry your request.

items.description: A summary of a change set returned in a list of change sets when the ListChangeSets action is called.

allOf.description: Array of ChangeSetSummaryListItem objects.
The value of the next token, if it exists. Null if there are no more results.

Catalog.description: The catalog related to the request. Fixed value: AWSMarketplace

allOf.description:
For ListEntities, the supported value for this is an EntityId.

For ListChangeSets, the supported values are as follows:

ListEntities - This is a list of unique EntityIds.

ListChangeSets - The supported filter names and associated ValueLists is as follows:

  • ChangeSetName - The supported ValueList is a list of non-unique ChangeSetNames. These are defined when you call the StartChangeSet action.

  • Status - The supported ValueList is a list of statuses for all change set requests.

  • EntityId - The supported ValueList is a list of unique EntityIds.

  • BeforeStartTime - The supported ValueList is a list of all change sets that started before the filter value.

  • AfterStartTime - The supported ValueList is a list of all change sets that started after the filter value.

  • BeforeEndTime - The supported ValueList is a list of all change sets that ended before the filter value.

  • AfterEndTime - The supported ValueList is a list of all change sets that ended after the filter value.

items.description: A filter object, used to optionally filter results from calls to the ListEntities and ListChangeSets actions.

Sort.description: An object that contains two attributes, SortBy and SortOrder.

allOf.description:
For ListEntities, supported attributes include LastModifiedDate (default), Visibility, EntityId, and Name.

For ListChangeSets, supported attributes include StartTime and EndTime.
The sorting order. Can be ASCENDING or DESCENDING. The default value is DESCENDING.

MaxResults.description: The maximum number of results returned by a single call. This value must be provided in the next call to retrieve the next set of results. By default, this value is 20.

NextToken.description: The token value retrieved from a previous call to access the next page of results.

post.description: Lists all tags that have been added to a resource (either an entity or change set).

allOf.description: Required. The ARN associated with the resource you want to list tags on.
The key associated with the tag.
The value associated with the tag.

items.description: A list of objects specifying each key name and value.

allOf.description: Required. A list of objects specifying each key name and value. Number of objects allowed: 1-50.

ResourceArn.description: Required. The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) associated with the resource you want to list tags on.

post.description: Attaches a resource-based policy to an Entity. Examples of an entity include: AmiProduct and ContainerProduct.

ResourceArn.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Entity resource you want to associate with a resource policy.

Policy.description: The policy document to set; formatted in JSON.

post.description:
Allows you to request changes for your entities. Within a single ChangeSet, you can't start the same change type against the same entity multiple times. Additionally, when a ChangeSet is running, all the entities targeted by the different changes are locked until the change set has completed (either succeeded, cancelled, or failed). If you try to start a change set containing a change against an entity that is already locked, you will receive a ResourceInUseException error.

For example, you can't start the ChangeSet described in the example later in this topic because it contains two changes to run the same change type (AddRevisions) against the same entity (entity-id@1).

For more information about working with change sets, see Working with change sets. For information on change types for single-AMI products, see Working with single-AMI products. Als, for more information on change types available for container-based products, see Working with container products.

For ListChangeSets, the supported values are as follows:

ListEntities - This is a list of unique EntityIds.

ListChangeSets - The supported filter names and associated ValueLists is as follows:

  • ChangeSetName - The supported ValueList is a list of non-unique ChangeSetNames. These are defined when you call the StartChangeSet action.

  • Status - The supported ValueList is a list of statuses for all change set requests.

Filter.description: A filter object, used to optionally filter results from calls to the ListEntities and ListChangeSets actions.

allOf.description: The name for the entity. This value is not unique. It is defined by the seller.
The type of the entity.
The unique identifier for the entity.
The ARN associated with the unique identifier for the entity.
The last time the entity was published, using ISO 8601 format (2018-02-27T13:45:22Z).

The visibility status of the entity to buyers. This value can be Public (everyone can view the entity), Limited (the entity is visible to limited accounts only), or Restricted (the entity was published and then unpublished and only existing buyers can view it).

items.description: This object is a container for common summary information about the entity. The summary doesn't contain the whole entity structure, but it does contain information common across all entities.
